question: 付ける
sourceAnswer: to{} attach/join/add/append/affix/stick/glue/fasten/sew-on/apply-(ointment) | furnish-(a-house-with) | wear/put-on | keep-a-diary/make-an-entry | appraise/set-(a-price) | allot/budget/assign | bring-alongside | place-(under-guard-or-doctor) | follow/shadow | load/give-(courage-to) | keep-(an-eye-on) | establish-(relations-or-understanding) | turn-on-(light) | produce-flowers/produce-fruit
userAnswer: to{} attach/connect | add | wear | arrive | mark | make-an-entry
activeAnswer: to{} attach/connect | add | wear | arrive | mark | make-an-entry
userExplanation:
to to attach/affix/add/apply/connect
interpreted very broadly and abstractly
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>attach</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to attach something</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is actually the same as the one you learned with the kanji, meaning you should be able to read this one just fine.
